Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.ui.swing.interfaces

Interface JExtendedComponentInterface

All Superinterfaces:
JComponentInterface
public interface JExtendedComponentInterface
extends JComponentInterface

This interface associated with all swing components in the application form, that allows complex local editing with it's content. Yhis interface extends JComponentInterface interface

Since:
0.0.2
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961

    This interface describes modification modes for the given control

  • Method Details

    • setFormManager

      void setFormManager​(FormManager<?,​?> mgr)

      Set form manager for the given control to manage editing. If the form manager is not null, all modification modes will be added automatically (see addModificationMode(ModificationMode...)). If the form manager is null, all modification midel will be removed automatically (see removeModificationMode(ModificationMode...))

      Parameters:
      mgr - manager to set. Can be null

    • getFormManager

      FormManager<?,​?> getFormManager()

      Get current form manager for the given control.

      Returns:
      form manager for the given control. Can be null

    • addModificationMode

      void addModificationMode​(JExtendedComponentInterface.ModificationMode... modes)

      Allow modification modes foe the given control

      Parameters:
      modes - modification modes to add for the modifications.

    • removeModificationMode

      void removeModificationMode​(JExtendedComponentInterface.ModificationMode... modes)

      Reject modification modes for the given control

      Parameters:
      modes - modification modes to remove for the modifications.

    • getModificationModes

      java.util.Set<JExtendedComponentInterface.ModificationMode> getModificationModes()

      Get current modification modes for the given control.

      Returns:
      set of currently available modification model for the given control. The set will be unmodifiable

    • setComponentConvertor

      void setComponentConvertor​(JExtendedComponentInterface.Value2ComponentConvertor convertor)

      Set component convertor for the given control

      Parameters:
      convertor - component convertor. If null, default convertor will be used.
